intro: Microstylis merrillii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Microstylis merrillii is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the Caribbean. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
